Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Atrioventricular Conduction Prolongation in Cardiac Pacing

Trial_Design.evidence: This single-center, randomized controlled trial was conducted at a university-affiliated tertiary care hospital.

Participants.evidence: Cardiac surgical patients at risk of left ventricular failure post-cardiopulmonary bypass were included.

Intervention.evidence: Temporary BiVP optimization was the intervention, with no specific comparator.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to estimate atrial conduction using AVCP and assess its impact on pAVD.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were optimum cardiac output (OptCO) and mean arterial pressure (OptMAP), measured immediately post-bypass.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Seven patients were randomized, with three in the short-AVCP group (<64 ms) and four in the long-AVCP group (>64 ms).

Result_Outcome.evidence: OptCO and OptMAP were significantly lower in the short-AVCP group (p = 0.015 and p = 0.029).
